snippet: The collector, Rudy Kurniawan, was taken into custody in Los Angeles on charges filed in federal court in New York.
abstract: Wine dealer Rudy Kurniawan is arrested in Los Angeles by the Federal Bureau of Investigation on charges that he tried to sell counterfeit wine that, if genuine, would have been worth $1.3 million; Kurniawan a prominent figure in the wine world who sold $35 million worth of wine in 2006 alone, is expected to be transferred to New York where the charges of mail and wire fraud were filed.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: The collector, Rudy Kurniawan, was taken into custody in Los Angeles on charges filed in federal court in New York.

headline.seo: Wine Dealer Accused of Trying to Sell Counterfeits
headline.main: Renowned Wine Dealer Accused of Trying to Sell Counterfeits
headline.print_headline: Renowned Wine Dealer Accused of Trying to Sell Counterfeits
